ch.bfh.ti.project1.RPiHSM.API

Class KeyStatus

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.bfh.ti.project1.RPiHSM.API.KeyStatus

  • public final class KeyStatus
extends Object

    KeyStatus

    Ask the IoT application using the SerialHelperI to promote, demote or revoke a key with the given parameters.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      KeyStatus(SerialHelperI serialHelper, String userPath, String name, int version)
      Sets SerialHelperI instance to communicate with the IoT application and key status operation parameters.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean demote()
      Checks if the key set with the CreateKey.name exists and if yes, it ask to the IoT application to demote the given key version of the given key set.
      boolean promote()
      Checks if the key set with the CreateKey.name exists and if yes, it ask to the IoT application to promote the given key version of the given key set.
      boolean revoke()
      Checks if the key set with the CreateKey.name exists and if yes, it ask to the IoT application to revoke the given key version of the given key set.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • KeyStatus

        public KeyStatus(SerialHelperI serialHelper,
                 String userPath,
                 String name,
                 int version)
        Sets SerialHelperI instance to communicate with the IoT application and key status operation parameters.
        Parameters:
        serialHelper - an instance of SerialHelperI
        userPath - home path of the IoT application user
        name - name of the key set
        version - key version where execute the operation

    • Method Detail

      • demote

        public boolean demote()
               throws OperationNotSupportedException
        Checks if the key set with the CreateKey.name exists and if yes, it ask to the IoT application to demote the given key version of the given key set.
        Returns:
        true if the key has been demoted, false otherwise
        Throws:
        OperationNotSupportedException - if an error occurs in the SerialHelperI

      • promote

        public boolean promote()
                throws OperationNotSupportedException
        Checks if the key set with the CreateKey.name exists and if yes, it ask to the IoT application to promote the given key version of the given key set.
        Returns:
        true if the key has been promoted, false otherwise
        Throws:
        OperationNotSupportedException - if an error occurs in the SerialHelperI

      • revoke

        public boolean revoke()
               throws OperationNotSupportedException
        Checks if the key set with the CreateKey.name exists and if yes, it ask to the IoT application to revoke the given key version of the given key set.
        Returns:
        true if the key has been revoked, false otherwise
        Throws:
        OperationNotSupportedException - if an error occurs in the SerialHelperI
